intro: Astragalus jaubertianus, commonly known as Jaubert's milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
